title: Buffer Overflow in writeSingleBuffer
description: The function `writeSingleBuffer` writes data to a USB device without checking if the provided buffer size exceeds the maximum packet size. This can lead to a buffer overflow.
fix: Add a check to ensure that the data length does not exceed the maximum packet size before writing it to the device.

reasoning.exploit_example: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by providing a large data buffer that exceeds the maximum packet size, causing the device to write beyond its allocated memory. This could lead to arbitrary code execution or other malicious actions.
